title: Alana Arden
author: Alana Arden
content: After joining the community, I was confused by so many posts about Bitcoin. Where to start, where to end, which one to read first, which one to read quickly, etc. I lost interest in reading my posts. Just then, it occurred to me that it wouldn't be this way; I have to start from scratch, and to maintain the order and beauty of a place, I have to first obey the rules of that place. Only then can I propel myself to my next step. So I am starting to know the rules of the forum by reading the post at this link  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0 Because nothing is above the rules. To keep the community clean, we (especially us newbies) need to follow the forum rules and posts. We have to slowly move forward in this journey of Bitcoin by following the rules of the forum community.We newbies hope you will surely benefit from the link post, like me.Please correct me if there is any mistake in what I said.

comments.author: Dunamisx
comments.body: Quote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMAfter joining the community, I was confused by so many posts about Bitcoin. Where to start, where to end, which one to read first, which one to read quickly, etc. I lost interest in reading my posts. Just then, it occurred to me that it wouldn't be this way; I have to start from scratch, and to maintain the order and beauty of a place, I have to first obey the rulesEven in every government settings, there are rules and regulations and anyone against any of those rules have to pay the consequences attached, the best ticket to enjoying this forum is to first go through the forum's rules and regulations, this will let the user have a direction that will guide his behaviors on this forum if he wish to stay, but non compliance to the rules is the quickest way to end one's stay from here, lastly always don't forget not to plagiarize, this also is common to newbies.

comments.author: Saisher
comments.body: Quote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMBecause nothing is above the rules. To keep the community clean, we (especially us newbies) need to follow the forum rules and posts. We have to slowly move forward in this journey of Bitcoin by following the rules of the forum community.We newbies hope you will surely benefit from the link post, like me.Please correct me if there is any mistake in what I said.Those newbies who come here and go straight into the bounty campaign are here to make money and there are newbies who come here because they love to learn about Bitcoin and learn things about Cryptocurrency, between the two we all know the latter is the one paying attention to the rules and how to contribute here in Bitcointalk.So we have two sets of newbies, newbies whose motivation is to make money and newbies who like to learn about Bitcoin, newbies who just do bounty campaigns and do not leave the bounty campaign section they don't care about other sections of Bitcointalk, they are missing a lot of things.

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Quote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMPlease correct me if there is any mistake in what I said.Nothing you said was wrong, you’re on the right path.But you should keep in mind that being familiar with the forum rules won’t make you know more about bitcoin automatically, so as you’re getting to know more about the forum make sure you read about bitcoin so that when you can now easily navigate around the forum you will also have something to offer to discussions Aswr in what you’ve learned so far, so do well to keep learning. This might not be related to your topics but here’s a list of links that will help you improve your knowledge, and keep in mind that no one here is perfect so if you encounter any problems do well to use the search option and if you still couldn’t get any solutions then go ahead and create a thread like you just did, but make sure you kind the type of threads you create so that you won’t end up creating threads every two minutes which will later turn to spam. Mastering Bitcoin.[General] Bitcoin Wallets - Which, what, why?Bitcoin information and resourcesRecommended walletsSecurity checklist

comments.author: Cointxz
comments.body: Quote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMAfter joining the community, I was confused by so many posts about Bitcoin. Where to start, where to end, which one to read first, which one to read quickly, etc. I lost interest in reading my posts.This happened to me when I’m still newbie and don’t know what I actually searching here in the forum. I discover this forum 2015 but I didn't create an account since I don't know exactly what to do here while I can still browse all the post available on all the board.I have courage to register in the forum after I already find my interest in crypto and to determine which I really like to discover here. On my case, I'm interested on altcoin trading on c-cex and at the same time joining on hyip and doubler. These is what makes me pursue Bitcointalk and later discover more on Bitcoin since it's the primary discussion here.Determine what you really and search it so that you can have reason on your stay here. Browsing tons of post and discussion will surely makes you lost since you don't have any idea what they are talking. Focus on one topic at a time.

comments.author: Yamane_Keto
comments.body: Bitcointalk rules are the same as those you might find in any forum, but the administration here is serious about implementing them, unlike other forums. The plagiarism policy is very strict, with less severe policies for spam and AI posts, in which you receive a warning or the post will be deleted. The only unusual thing that you should be aware of is plagiarism, which leads to you being banned without any warning, but all the other rules are simple and should be followed by anyone who wants a healthy discussion.

comments.author: stompix
comments.body: Quote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMSo I am starting to know the rules of the forum by reading the post at this link  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0 ~Please correct me if there is any mistake in what I said.Rule #1!Quote1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads. This is the exact low-value topic we need to keep off this forum, everyone coming here as a "newbie" and telling how important it is to follow rules!Lock the topic!

comments.author: hd49728
comments.body: Quote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMSo I am starting to know the rules of the forum by reading the post at this link  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0 Because nothing is above the rules.You are a beginner, newbie and are posting in Beginners & Help board with a sticky threadNewbies - Read before postingThe thread you shared is one of stick threads in Bitcointalk.[Bitcointalk sticky threads] Newbies - read before starting.You can find more helpful threads with search and in Beginners & Help EncyclopediaGenerally I seriously think why you need to create this topic, fishing merit?

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Welcome OP. It is nice having you here. As a matter of fact, all you have said is the raw truth and nothing different from the truth. You know it is normal that every organisation, platforms, groups etc all have rules, guidelines and principles which they must abide by to keep them together and for things to work orderly and accordingly. Same is applicable here and for the fact that you took such step, it shows that you are willing and ready to learn more about bitcoin and this platform. As i can see you already have started doing that. However, some links have already been posted here by members which would be of help to you and i believe if you read them accordingly, you would benefit from them.Avoid plagiarism here because the community frowns at it and if caught in the act might result to you likely being tagged. So therefore, you should do well to always reference your post if you copied it from else where so that it would not make you face some backlash here. As a newbie, what you will just have to do now is concentrate on reading, learning to gain more knowledge. You can ask question here if you feel there is anything you are lacking in knowledge here and you want to get clarification on.Lastly, I do not know where you are from but i will advice you to locate your local board as there is a local board session where one can freely interact with their locals and also communicate with their local language for better and easier understanding. Here you can meet with other members you would also guide you through your stay here.You can as well ask question there as it bothers you.

comments.author: Jawhead999
comments.body: Working with Bitcoin by following the forum rules? it's obvious you're refer to signature campaign There's no such working with Bitcoin except you're a miner and I believe you're not. Moreover learning and start your journey in Bitcoin space doesn't require you to understand this forum rules, you don't have to create a new account or you can just become a silent reader.

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: What you must know about the forum here is that there is nothing too new and there's nothing too old here about the rules the problems is that you newbies always wanted an easy going life whereby you just suddenly want to be like others without knowing there are prizes to pay here. And these prizes includes devoting yourself to first discover where you are and then followed by the orderliness of the rules and then looks at where their discussion are channeling to before jumping into discussion or going elsewhere to source information to share here. Apparently here is the number places that highly prioritize rules and orderliness whomever that can't maintain and cultivate a reading mentality would always finds it difficult to scale through this forum which I know too well that here is a free place but the ability to remember some of the rules and abides to them is the major headaches.

comments.author: SatoPrincess
comments.body: Honestly this post looks like it was made to fish merit. This is how I see this post “Oh look at me I’m not like the other newbies who don’t read the forum rules, I’m a good newbie and should get merit”Even though you didn’t say the exact words and there was no mention of merit, your topic comes off as an attempt to fish merits. Newbies creating topics about plagiarism and writing patterns is a common method used by alt accounts.

comments.author: Accardo
comments.body: Learning bitcoin or embarking on the journey of bitcoin, doesn’t require you to follow the forum rules, many guests learn here without creating accounts. The rule is meant for account owners like myself and you to keep the forum clean. Contributing on bitcoin related discussions is great in helping you understand bitcoin faster. And participating in the practical aspect of the bitcoin technology also helps to create a long lasting experience with the other members of the forum. Who, like a voluntary duty, derive joy in helping newbies and members to comprehend the idea and future of bitcoin technology. It’s great that you've read the rules, you only need it to participate in the discussion here safely, without breaking any rule that can ban your account. The contents here are too many, so get started with the few and simple threads, ask questions where possible and expect to see valuable responses that’ll make here a quality learning place for you. Good luck!

comments.author: Razmirraz
comments.body: When you start setting foot in a new place, the first thing you need to do is read all the rules listed on the notice board. After understanding all the rules in that place, you have to get used to integrating with the people you are there. Of course, as a foreigner or new arrival, you need help from residents who have lived there for a long time.The atmosphere of sharing has left a beautiful impression for members who have succeeded in gaining knowledge about Bitcoin, you can also be like them if you really have the intention to learn. If you have just started studying Bitcoin, of course you will be curious about what Bitcoin is, why people are so enthusiastic about getting Bitcoin, how to get it and where is a safe place to store it. These are all the basics you need to learn, if you still feel confused, don't hesitate to ask.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: a good first step if you start by studying the forum rules first, it will be good for your next journey in the forum, so that you are more careful when you already know what you can and cannot do.I suggest you, focus on your interests in the forum first. There are lots of topics discussed on the forum, you don't need to follow them all, it will actually make you confused if you don't master them. it is better to focus on a few points if you are interested in Bitcoin or mining and even Bitcoin trading. You can go to forums that discuss it. You can use the search feature to find more specific topics you want to read about.

comments.author: aioc
comments.body: Newbies who just came here should stop posting discussions like this as if they know a lot of things in this forum already, newbies will listen to old timers not newbies like them because they will think why should we listen to you when you are a newbie like us, get in the healthy discussion that you know or you can give a good input not teaching a newbie how to behave here, do so after a few months, that's the time you will learn a lot about the forum and many things on it.

comments.author: Ojima-ojo
comments.body: This rules eachbtime i take a look at them gives me alot of excitement because to some extent the forum does not have any strict rules that will the forum hard for newbies to understand because for as long as the newbie understands the rules of the forum and align their activities here to the rules, they will have no issues.The forum laws are also properly spelt out and explained in a clear terms so that everyone can find it easy, and which I is why you can easily navigate yourself around it.

comments.author: Die_empty
comments.body: Quote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMPlease correct me if there is any mistake in what I said.You are welcome to the forum. Studying the rules of the forum is very important so I have to commend you for reading them. I also assume that your post will be helpful to newbies. But I checked your post history and it shows that you have made five posts of which three are new threads you created.  I always advise newbies to read more and write less. You need time to understand the workings of the forum before you start making posts. Your post will be appreciated if it contains information that will be helpful to the forum. If you had used the search option of the forum, you would have discovered that you can find the information in your post in many threads.

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: If you want to stay long in this Bitcointalk forum, do everything possible to follow up the rules because the rules doesn't have respect to any rank whether newbies or legendary. Once you understand the rules and obey all the rules governed the forum and you are more dedicated in this forum by reading cryptocurrency books and some of the quality Post made by the potential bitcoiners, I guess your journey will not hard you to improve higher to become member rank or full member in the forum. Don't forget to check every discussion forum very well to know where and where to create your topic that will respond to that forum discussion not to be harass in such mistakes because is good for you to learn very well before creating topics in the forum.

comments.author: khiholangkang
comments.body: Quote from: stompix on September 28, 2023, 10:29:30 AMQuote from: Alana Arden on September 28, 2023, 09:47:05 AMSo I am starting to know the rules of the forum by reading the post at this link  https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=703657.0 ~Please correct me if there is any mistake in what I said.Rule #1!Quote1. No zero or low value, pointless or uninteresting posts or threads. This is the exact low-value topic we need to keep off this forum, everyone coming here as a "newbie" and telling how important it is to follow rules!Lock the topic!As for posts that are interesting or not valuable, I think that is subjective, sir, sorry for my impudence in saying this, but that is the nature of it.In fact, I think that beginners who do this kind of thing are alt accounts to get attention and merit, what they do as if they "care about the forum" from their activities is quite predictable.LogicallyJudging from the natural habits of newbies, they don't do this, like opening a thread and stating that they care about the forum so as to provide ways on how they can give advice to other newbies, judging by the very little activity on his account, how can he be anxious and care about this matter.I agree with you for the key to the topic, because there are too many topics like this.
